problems.title: Fractional Knapsack
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You have a knapsack with capacity W.
There are N items, each with a weight and value.
You can take fractions of items (not just whole items).

Find the maximum total value you can put in the knapsack.

Greedy Strategy: Always pick items with the highest value-to-weight ratio first!
This maximizes value per unit weight.

Output the result rounded to 2 decimal places.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 50
60 10
100 20
120 30

Sample Output
240.00

Explanation:
Capacity = 50
Items (value, weight): [(60, 10), (100, 20), (120, 30)]
Value/Weight ratios: [6.0, 5.0, 4.0]

Sorted by ratio: [(60, 10), (100, 20), (120, 30)]

1. Take full item 1: Value = 60, Capacity left = 40
2. Take full item 2: Value = 60 + 100 = 160, Capacity left = 20
3. Take 20/30 of item 3: Value = 160 + (20/30)*120 = 160 + 80 = 240

Total Value = 240.00

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n, capacity = map(int, data[0].split())
    items = []
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        v, w = map(int, data[i].split())
        items.append((v, w))
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.fractionalKnapsack(items, capacity)
    print(f"{result:.2f}")

hintsList: Calculate value/weight ratio for each item and sort items by this ratio in descending order.
Iterate through sorted items: if the item fits completely, take it all. Otherwise, take the fraction that fits.
